Oh no. Oh no...
I was holding off on publishing a review until I finished watching. Not for any hope that something like this would get better, but simply due to the fact that I couldn't bring myself to write about whatever this is. Eromanga-sensei is everything wrong with the anime industry. And you know what? That's not funny. I see so many jokes about that concept. How viewers laughingly remark about this series' and how horrible it is but eat it up regardless, promoting this utter shit until it becomes the most popular non-sequel of the season.
And it is. Eromanga Sensei is the most popularnon-sequel in Japan. Can you believe it? A show about a fourteen year old trying to fuck his twelve year old sister while she molests other twelve year old girls is the most popular program in Japan. It is probably the most popular program amongst western anime fans too. It baffles me. Coming from a western background, series like Game of Thrones and Breaking Bad steal that limelight. Sure we have duds like The Walking Dead drifting about with their cable appeal, but even that is understandable to me. At least that has elements of redeemable quality.


Eromanga has none of that. Eromanga is the mutated lovechild of everything that's hate-able about this industry and the sole reason why anime series' won't ever be taken seriously. For every angered fan of anime that realizes that their favorite show or non-ghibli film will never see the light of day in any extended theater run or any major awards show; this is why. Eromanga Sensei is hopefully the worst series I'll watch to completion. That's because as a viewer I've mostly stuck with some of the most popular anime. I've made my way through the highly-touted projects and ignored the seasonal popularity. Well, this is my first time delving deep into it and it yields an unforgettable, but totally forgettable product that fails at even the most basic storytelling. 


This will have spoilers. If you are reading this and haven't seen the show, good. Don't watch it. It isn't worth it. It's not funny, or engaging, and the memes you have seen about it don't give a holistic representation of the insane tedium which this show revels in. This show isn't "so bad it's good." Far from it. 


Eromanga-Sensei is just fucking garbage. 


_____________________________________________________________________________________________________



[A Dancing Girl and a Pedophile] 



This series follows a harem protagonist on a mission to fuck with a plethora of forgettable girl archetypes that you've seen a million times in a million different anime. The girl that he will end up being with is Sagiri, his twelve year old NEET sister who has not left her room in years. He also happens to write shitty light novels, much like the ones this series is based on, and his artist just so happens to be the twelve year old non-blood related sister living upstairs. What a coincidence! And of course he finds out and helps her hide her identity. 


Then we meet a few other girls who are also light novel writers and play no role other than to create fanservice scenes that aren't just of the main girl. Honestly, the first ten episodes of this series really don't matter. The eleventh episode provides some much needed backstory which just renders the rest of the series up until that point completely useless. Anyway, Eromanga is just a series of empty husks waddling around on screen. It is a collection of sexual gifs that patrol the internet. From the totally inexplicable character writing to the horrendously boring direction to the non-story that is told throughout this series, Eromanga struggles to get anything right. 


_____________________________________________________________________________________________________


[Visuals]



The visuals are probably the most positive aspect in this series, and even they are incredibly uneven. You see, A-1 hired a unique key animator for Sagiri, the little sister, and only Sagiri. So her animation is often much more fluid than the rest of the characters. This creates an animated whiplash of epic proportions. You go from a well-animated movement to a seizure-like stutter within the same scene. So even if her animation is good, this show has a tendency to skimp out on everything else. 


Some highlights are absurdly off-model characters that kind of look hilarious. Really egregious oversights, even in the shows forgettable OP. A-1, like they do, put the minimal effort required into making this show palatable to look at while forgetting to actually give it direction. It looks like any generic as all hell sitcom. Bad. 


Every episode is mostly just a compilation of characters sitting around talking exposition for minutes on end before they get to the two minutes of fanservice that peppers the internet for the next few days. They virtually just include the last eighteen minutes for no discernible reason. This could've been just two minutes of soft-core porn and I think the fans would have been just as happy, if not more so, with this series. 


_____________________________________________________________________________________________________


[Sound]



It's bad. The OP is forgettable but not painful, the ED I already forgot. The show has a seasoned atrociousness, as it's unfunny and bland writing is often back-ended by painful background music. Now this ranges from "fat guy walking" tuba to "Squidward playing the clarinet" and it was initially funny that this series had such abrasive background music. But it got tedious really quick and ended up just making me angry by episode four. 


What can I say. This show sounds horrible.


_____________________________________________________________________________________________________



[Characters/Story]



Now lets get to the meat. And by meat, I mean the meat of a bunch of underage girls that are endlessly used as tools to turn on a bunch of creepy fucking virgins watching this series to get off. I get it, it's okay to imagine children naked if they are fake. And i'm a supporter of the notion that thought-crime shouldn't be illegal because it doesn't harm anyone. I don't honestly care what you think about on your free-time and I care even less if it is totally fictitious and not exploiting anything.


So my problems with this series isn't that it sexualizes kids. That's nothing new in anime (as disturbing as that is) and it is far from its biggest fault. It's pedophilic and gross, and I often felt ornery watching this series due to the kind of framing devices it used to express its sexuality. For example, instead of diagetically forcing fanservice on us, the director made the 'brave' choice of literally just having shots of characters from below. It felt like a pedophiles hidden camera every time a character was talking. 


Whether the show is being serious and dramatic or light-hearted and unfunny, the fanservice never ends. Character is being cute? Show them being cute with a below-the-skirt shot. Character crying? Have it framed so their still developing tits take up half the shot. It's cringe. It is a repulsive way to shoehorn this nonsense into your show. But on the other hand, this is the only thing this show has going for it anyway. It is riddled with plot-holes and totally clueless characters that defy any logic whatsoever. 


In one scene it is established that Sagiri cannot draw girls with big tits. Why? Because she uses herself as a model for all her drawings and she is twelve. So her brother, being the great, enabling guy he is, tells her to look up idols on google to discover how to draw big tits. It works! She can now draw big meatsacks. However, two episodes later she regresses back to not being able to draw titties because... a girl showed her, her panties on skype. Let me get this straight, seeing panties made you unable to draw tits. 


But it gets better. 


The way she says she can resolve this issue is if her brother literally lures girls into her room and has them show her their panties. Not only is that fucking creepy, but more importantly, how does drawing panties even relate to drawing tits? Why are glaring issues like this not resolved in the initial adaptation phase?! 


This would be fine. Well, no it actually wouldn't, but not as bad if it didn't lead to one of the most genuinely disturbing scenes i've seen in anime. Now i'm not one to be disturbed, although I am definitely one to cringe. But her brother does it. He finds a girl and drags her to her room, ties her up and blindfolds her and has Sagiri draw her panties. But get this, Sagiri, the twelve year old girl, rips that other twelve year old's panties off. She literally molests another girl. And it isn't really played as anything either, that girl is genuinely uncomfortable and so was I. Get this. They become great friends afterwards too. Talk about Stockholm syndrome. 


I wish this was the only ridiculous inanity that occurs, but it isn't. A character called Elf exists. She has pointy elf-ears for literally no reason. It is never explained or mentioned. She just does. Her characterization is as confusing as she is repulsive. Very much so. She shifts between big-sister-esq and comforting to childish and annoying to a complete tsundere from episode to episode and it makes virtually no sense. She is also a part of our protagonist's harem.


Which leads me to the third character. Muramasa. Who's probably the most well-designed of the bunch, but has the personality of a grapefruit.  She's a best selling light-novel author yet it is revealed that she was inspired by our harem protagonist's work ever since she was young. Well, younger. This was an element I guessed the second I saw the character simply because you can't have a character in a harem that is better than the male protagonist. You just can't. This is a power fantasy series for lonely kids and adults that want young girls to flock all over them in their dreams. So you can't have them be worse at anything. You need them to be virtually perfect. And our protagonist is.


These days, i'm developing a blase attitude towards the inherent sexism showed in anime. Which is a bit sad because I do love me a strong female character who "don't need no man". But you know, when the entire medium is marketed towards teenage boys it kind of makes sense to have every male be the best and every women be a toy to be played with. Even if it is obnoxious and kind of distressing.


This show is obviously not any different. In one titular scene we have our protagonist chat with the big brother of Elf, and when he discusses the great things about Elf the only thing he can say is, "She's nice and is a good cook." Wow. What a charmer. And this isn't even played off as a joke, this was a genuine scene with sappy, saccharine music in the background. 


This kind of character writing extends throughout the series, too. The character writing is so bad that it feels like our protagonist is maliciously playing with these girls, since he's shown to be so oblivious that it becomes hard to believe. He rejects a girl, but obviously she keeps pursuing him, but then he proceeds to invite her to plenty of social events, as if it won't be awkward as all hell for her. It truly is a baffling kind of attitude. 


I get the excuse, too, that he's just a "stupid teenager", and he is. But you know what? Using character stupidity as a plot contrivance isn't good writing. It doesn't make the protagonist or the story any better knowing this dude might actually be handicapped. It just makes it even more frustrating. 


We are getting front row seats to this idiot fucking with these girls. And it isn't funny. Whether he understands that he is doing this or not, it's happening, and it is the least funny thing in a show that is already aggressively unfunny. If it was well-written comedy then it could be played as dark humor, but it isn't, it's just a bunch of girls yelling "baka!" really loudly. 


To refer back to that scene of our protagonist talking with Elf's brother, who by the way asked him to marry her in that very scene. Get this, marrying a fourteen year old. He says that he would if he wasn't in love with someone else, referring to his twelve year old sister. However, the episode before he actually told the sister he would be with Muramasa if he wasn't in love with 'someone', as he puts it, since he's unable to admit his love of his sister, sometimes. So this entire scene played as a total contradiction, unless the protagonist was supposed to be a total lying scumbag fuck. I don't think that was intended, though. 


...


When it comes to script writing this show is a masterpiece. Much like a Michael Bay script, Eromanga has a tendency to describe everything that is shown. I'm not talking about emotions, i'm talking about literally shown. In one scene they are goofing off instead of working, and when the brother of Elf walks in to catch them in the act of goofing off, Elf stands up and literally explains what he is seeing. It is this baffling mixture of having to exposit a moment and also badly adapting dialogue from the light novel. 


You are seeing everything she is saying. It isn't even the whole "show don't tell" rule, that doesn't apply. That's a criticism for bad writing. This isn't bad writing. This is like the a new universe of writing. It is so abysmal that it bore it's way out of the crust of her earth and floated off into space. This kind of writing extends to multiple different episodes too, often times characters restate their purpose multiple times and it still leads to nothing. For example, the entirety of episode ten was about how Muramasa loves the protagonist, but that's been established since her second introductory episode. She literally just reuses the dialogue she used that episode. It is a special kind of absurd.



...



[Speed Round : This show is shit!]



* After a one-episode tournament-esq arc finishes, there is an after party to which everyone who participated in the competition established gets to come. Elf ends up going, even though she wasn't in the competition and this wasn't addressed at all. It was just an excuse to bring all the girls together. 


* Everything ties back to the MC for virtually no reason but to make him the focal point of every characters lives. Every character backstory has something to do with our main character and it might be the most contrived bullshit I've ever witnessed on screen. And I watched the entirety of SAO. 


* The backgrounds lack any detail whatsoever. We are in a character's room but their room doesn't have any personal mementos or knickknacks. In fact, the only room that has detail is Sagiri's, but she's a NEET with the cleanest room I've ever seen. 


* To piggy-back off that. She's a NEET hikikomori, stating she hasn't left her room in years. Yet her room is perfectly clean. There is also no bathroom in her room. How does this even work? Does she shit out of the window? This entire show plays this seriously negative affliction as totally okay. 


* Uninspired character designs. The parents of our two protagonists are virtually just the same characters but aged up. It is lazy as all hell. 


* This show lacks any timing whatsoever. Not only for it's comedic punchlines, but for its fanservice as well. Fanservice can strike at any time and it is distracting and undercuts any potential catharsis this show is trying to establish. 


* Episode eleven changes the entire story of the series and renders the past ten episodes totally irrelevant to where the conclusion is heading. 


* The finale was completely and utterly pointless, playing more like an OVA than a finale. It was nothing. Much like the rest of this series. 


* Girls get embarrassed for virtually no reason. As in, in one scene our protagonist is getting hit on by Elf on the beach as she asks him to spread some sunscreen on her back. Then once he repeats her orders she gets embarrassed about it. Why? Why is girls being embarrassed about inane shit such a cliche in anime? 


* In one episode of the series Sagiri makes Elf and Muramasa her models so she can draw them in revealing positions. Yet, to describe the positions, she draws them. So they are models she already had drawn... so why did she even need them to model in the first place? It made no fucking sense. 


* Muramasa was often played as the really "cute" one, as in, the characters acknowledged how pretty she was. However, since she has the same kind of body-type as any other girl, apart from bigger tits, it wasn't convincing at all. The usual anime presentation of "same-body, different standards" that makes no sense. 


* If you've noticed I haven't actually said what our protagonist's name is, and that's because it doesn't matter. 


* Every girl is a fucking slut. 


_____________________________________________________________________________________________________


[The state of anime]



My biggest gripe with this show isn't that it is bad. Well, it is, it's abhorrent in every way. But the biggest problem, and perhaps the most upsetting issue, is that it is so incredibly popular. It is, undoubtedly, in the mainstream. A show like Eromanga is the mainstream in anime. That is so fucking confusing to me. I tried to explain this earlier but the people who genuinely love this show seem incredibly insecure about their love for it. 


They explained to me that I'm simply being bias and that I'm "trying" to hate this show. When that isn't true at all. I actually discovered this show through a meme, which is ironically why it is popular in the first place, because it's made to be a  meme, and I thought the meme was kind of hilarious and I decided to watch the series. Sure, once I realized it is awful I went into every episode expecting nothing but terrible nonsense, but that's logical. You shouldn't go into a snake pit, get bitten, and then go into a snake pit again expecting not to get bitten. Maybe i'm just a masochist, but I feel like I needed to finish this series simply to experience the most awful possible thing.


However, to many people from what I've seen, this is far from the most awful possible thing. I was constantly told that this is just a "mediocre" show. That i'm over-exaggerating it's awfulness. To that I say, if this is mediocrity to you, then you might have the most incredibly low standard for television. If this is "mediocre" for anime, then anime fucking sucks. If this is "mediocre" for anything, then that anything is the worst.


It is paramount we criticize it too. Supporting a product like this will help fuel more products like this. In 2014,  Miyazaki said something incredibly poignant about anime as an industry, and the fans, instead of taking it seriously, decided to take it as a joke. He made it clear that as an industry, anime is spiraling out into nothingness. There is an endless loop of self-inspiration that will never actually prompt original or groundbreaking content. 


As an industry, anime is otaku driven, and as a people, according to Miyazaki, otaku's aren't usually capable of understanding how people work. And if you are writing characters to represent people and don't understand how people work, your characters will take roles that are wholly unrealistic. We already see this in anime constantly. Completely stupid character archetypes that simply don't exist in the real world, from Tsunderes to the concept of a pure, yet sexual girls that seems to inhabit essentially every anime with inherent, childish sexuality in it. 


So when these totally unaware shows become popular and are roots for inspiration, they spawn more shows like them. Much like SAO did, much like Re:Zero is doing, much like Eromanga sensei will do, and it is a constant loop of something getting worse and worse. It's not funny. It isn't worth joking about. It genuinely makes this industry look awful. I care because I love animation, and while anime and I have mixed feelings about each other, I can't help but support animation as a medium and I want to see it succeed and be utilized to its full potential. But as it stands, anime is hardly scratching the surface and it will continue to scratch less and less as this loop of uncreativity continues. Which is deeply saddening. 


_____________________________________________________________________________________________________


[Conclusion and Criticism]



Criticizing something is important. Critics help spur movements and change notions and promote something of quality. Look no further than the French New Wave, the most influential movement in film history which was spawned in the palms of upset critics that wanted to change the status quo. This movement permeated throughout the world and ended up inspiring the greatest films and directors in of all time. Without the French New Wave, some of the greatest anime wouldn't even exist. Satoshi Kon wouldn't have edited like he did. Monogatari wouldn't have its signature style. At its base, this starts with a criticism. Bringing attention to something. It is incredibly important to fight for the kind of television you want to see. 


I get it, though, not everyone wants this in their television. Some viewers just want to see cute girls prance around on screen saying random shit and yelling "baka!" loudly. I get it. Some people don't care about a narrative, or characters, or even visuals half the time. This show being popular makes that clear. However, on behalf of everyone that does care. That does want television, specifically anime to push itself further away from the stigma regarding the quality of the medium, I ask you to perhaps watch a series with cute girls but in a narrative that actually exists. Characters that are actually there. And there are plenty of shows like that, too. You don't have to settle for something like Eromanga-Sensei.


Kyoto Animation specializes in cute girls but with engaging characters, exceptional directing, and spectacular visuals. If you are looking for porn, look up porn. If you want to watch a series, make the sacrifice of watching something that at least has an element of positivity past sexualizing its objects. This'll promote series that will actually create maybe something a bit more interesting and original. 


Eromanga-Sensei is genuinely a saddening experience. It is so incredibly bad in just about every way, yet people really love it. It is so popular that it will spawn plenty of sequels and shows copying its already cliche formula that it truly makes me upset. An industry that is already a mecca for unoriginal concepts that virtually just copy one another will just continue to be an industry of looping inspiration and nothing to break up the tedious formula.


Eromanga-sensei is truly the worst.

Unless you’ve been living under a rock for the past century, it’s no secret how perverse the Japanese culture can be sometimes, mainly in the medium of anime. Writers and producers litter their animations with heavily endowed females, ecchi harems bordering on hentai and lewd jokes about a ten-year-old’s panties. Anime like High School DXD and Masou Gakuen HXH continue to push the boundary of what is acceptable to show to its viewers, and I’ve been partly responsible at times myself of indulging in this trashy, sexual fanservice. However, with A-1 Studio’s 2017 release of Eromanga Sensei, I’ve officially hit a tipping point in myopinions of what is right and wrong. The series exhausts every effort to forcefully suggest an “incestuous” relationship between a teenager and his stepsister. What results is one of the most disgusting, tasteless works of fiction ever produced. It's a show that’s harrowing to my own morality, and whose influence could degrade the already thinning strand of legitimacy the anime industry has left. 


As soon as Eromanga Sensei begins, evidence of the writer’s true intentions come to light. Masamune, our main protagonist, lives with his mother, and Sagiri, the blushing lolli, lives with her father. Magically the pair’s parents become romantically involved and eventually make the decision to live together. Thus, their dramatic introduction begins, leading to the intended incest theme. Sagiri appears from behind her father’s back, timid and radiating with a brilliant light of angelic proportions. Masamune locks eyes with her and is immediately overcome with romantic intentions. It’s naturally what every 13 year old does when meeting their preteen stepsister for the first time...amirite? Apparently the manga’s writer Tsukasa Fushimi had a previous work in which he tried to force the ACTUAL brother and sister to be in a relationship, only to have the idea not get greenlighted for obvious ethical reasons. Hell, I guess even some of Japan has a moral conscience.


Fast-forward a few years to the devastating yet convenient turn of events in which the two parents perish in an undetailed car accident and Masamune and Sagiri are forced to live with each other. Naturally Sagiri locks herself in her room, forcing her “brother” to answer to her every beck and call. Masamune is an aspiring manga author who works with an anonymous erotic manga artist in hopes of someday hitting it big in the industry. However, while anxiously viewing one of his masked partner’s live streams, Masamune accidentally discovers that Eromanga-Sensei’s true identity is that of his own sister Sagiri...


THE PLOT THICKENS.


The rest of the anime is rather generic from a plot perspective. Sagiri and Masamune are secretly attracted to each other, however neither of them admit their infatuation due to a plethora of awkward misunderstandings. More female characters enter the fray, further clouding Masamune’s perception of love, and at the end of it all we as viewers are left with nothing more than a shell of a stereotypical romantic comedy. There’s just one catch. It isn’t the overall plot structure that bothers me about Eromanga Sensei. It isn’t the apparent reality that every teenager in Japan is a manga author. It isn’t even the vanilla or recycled characters omnipresent in seemingly every facet of the series. What incessantly infuriates me about this anime is the shameless amount of forced sexual topics and fanservice shoved down my throat around every turn. I’m not by any stretch of the imagination an ecchi fan, but at least most of them have the decency to shy away from the taboo of lolita porn. Scattered shots of some rather private scenes involving Sagiri or other pre-teen girls, either blatant or subtle leave a disgusting taste in my mouth. Added to this are countless suggestive panty shots, only fueling the stigma many already possess related to the anime industry. Not to mention the mention the random expletive from a twelve year old about liking penises. Is the industry even trying anymore?


All of the fanservice aside, the aspect of Eromanga Sensei I found most unnerving is the suggested incestuous relationship between Masamune and Sagiri. Countless anime before it have alluded to or even explored the romantic sibling complex (Koi Kaze, OreImo, No Game No Life), but Fushimi’s methods in Eromanga are so sloppy and pathetic it’s embarrassing. There is no “relationship” between the two main characters. It’s as if they are actors dropped into an improv scene with pre-assigned roles. “Oh, this is when I’m supposed to blush when he says something!” or “Oh, I better internal monologue about my sister now”. It all reeks of contrivance and agenda. At least OreImo seemed more realistic in its relationship development. And when are we going to draw the line with what is acceptable to release in an anime? Shock value scenes with large breasts and convenient erotic shots are desensitizing and generally understood to be exaggeratory. However, showcasing more personal themes like incest to such an impressional target audience can actually have long-lasting effects with their ability to discern what is moral and acceptable.


SPOILER ALERT- It’s not normal to want to have sex with your brother or sister. 


I digress.


Fushimi’s creation of Masamune was flawed in how he appears to just “exist” without really creating much opportunity for relatability. The feelings for his sister are never really internalized or matured, but instead seem to exist from the moment he meets her. For the rest of the anime, viewers are now transfixed on what taboo thought or emotion Masamune will have for Sagiri and couldn’t care less about him as a person. His manga author career serves as nothing more than a vessel to exploit his relationship and complicate things as more loli’s are introduced. It’s cringeworthy characterization at best. In essence, Masamune is just a plot device for the underlying themes of the show. Well done sir, you created one of the most boring characters in anime history.


Sagiri is the most forgivable character in Eromanga Sensei. She’s young, so in a way, she has an excuse for acting the way she does in terms of isolationism when her father passes away. Her interpretation of what an acceptable relationship is could also be skewed due to her young age, which is why she has strange feelings for her brother. Unfortunately, this does far less than make her an interesting character. At times, she can be really frustrating because of how irrational her behavior can be and it doesn’t help her build a strong likability case. Elf is cute, annoying, and is the tsundere trope in a nutshell. Another plot device with pre-installed emotions and perogatives. The rest of the cast does far from marvel, consisting of a gaggle of uninspired and forgettable personalities. Character development does little to nothing in justifying the existence of such a tasteless anime.


Animation wise, Eromanga is what you would expect from an anime in 2017. Flashy, bright hues accompany each scene, with a plethora of cutesy blushing character models to boot. Each character was constructed with individuality in mind, so their appearance is unique and eye-catching. It’s a shame more couldn’t have been done in the art department to overshadow the supreme lack of depth in the characters themselves. And as attractive as the models looked, it wasn’t enough to salvage the eventual trainwreck bestowed upon them by Fushimi’s writing.


The music in Eromanga Sensei was playful and fun, ad nauseum. Whether it was the seemingly innocent and bubbly OP, or the adorable ED sequence of Sagiri dancing in front of a laundry machine, the cute factor was never dialed down from 11. The rest of the OST fit in well with the scenes as much as I hate to say it, I really can’t fault the sound designers here. Voice acting was also believable and well cast.


As I descend from my soapbox, I’ll leave you with this. Eromanga Sensei is not a “quality” anime. It may be disguised with endearing female characters and a relationship portrayed as innocent or normal, but when you brush off the surface you’ll find nothing more than a lewd and often inappropriately centered series. I wouldn’t even recommend it to someone that I know would like it, because at some point the spread of immoral content has to stop. Fans of shows like this are what gives the anime industry a negative light in mainstream media. Maybe when we start to take the medium serious and stop promoting crap like this, more skilled writers and producers will be drawn to it. Honestly, I’m embarrassed as an anime fan that a show like Eromanga Sensei even exists. As always, thanks for reading and be sure to check out my other reviews!

Characters- 1

Art- 7

Sound- 3

Enjoyment-1

Overall- 1.8

Introduction:
Yeah, I know I'm WAY late to this party. A friend requested a review though, so why not? Eromanga Sensei made quite the splash online as THE bad anime of 2017. Gigguk hyped it up famously as "The perfect bad anime" and "The ULTIMATE bad anime". He made it seem like it's so bad it's amazing and hysterical. Sadly, I must disagree. Eromanga Sensei is NOT "The Room" of anime. It isn't uniquely bad or uniquely depraved. It's just an amalgamation of the shittiest cliches and tropes from other bad echii anime. 
Background:
Art in general is highly subjective, but what qualifies as "So bad it'sgood" is especially fuzzy. For me personally, the best examples either display extreme technical incompetence where the creators clearly didn’t know what they are doing, or batshit insane projects that beat all the odds by somehow getting made in the first place. Let's look at a classic bad movie with Dolemite. I’ve never seen a film where the director gave less of a fuck. The lead actor flubs a line? Who cares! Keep shooting. The sound equipment AND crew are visible? Who cares! An actor wasn’t ready and has to run to his cue at the start of a scene? Doesn’t matter. Every fight scene is our overweight protagonist awkwardly lifting his leg in the rough proximity of the bad guys and them hurling themselves backwards. The writing is astonishingly bad throughout. On a purely technical level, Dolemite makes The Room look like Citizen Kane. It’s that perfect type of mesmerizingly bad where it’s impossible to tell what was intentionally funny and what was honest incompetence. 


Now let's look at some underdog stories that beat the odds just by getting made. Look at every movie made by Troma entertainment. Lloyd Kaufman graduated from Yale and had the intelligence and the right friends (including Oliver Stone) to be a major Hollywood director. However, he hated that movies were greenlit or denied by a board of executives based on how well they were projected to sell. Kaufman rebelled and founded a studio based entirely around producing the ludicrous shit that would NEVER get greenlit elsewhere. Most of these movies were indeed horrible like “They Call me Macho Woman” and “Surf Nazis Must Die”, but Kaufman’s middle finger to Hollywood gave him cult status as a kind of anti-hero. It’s thanks to people like Kaufman that we get rare indy gems like “Six Stringed Samurai”. That’s a movie about a katana wielding Buddy Holly! He’s on a quest to find the last American city after a nuclear war and claim the throne from Elvis. The soundtrack couldn’t afford to use Buddy Holly or Elvis…so they found some random Russian band called the Red Elvises, who were willing to do the soundtrack for free. The Red Elvises specialize in playing 1960s Surf Rock and Rockabilly using a balalaika instead of a guitar! Six Stringed Samurai is the kind of insane shit that SOMEHOW exists and should be celebrated for that reason alone!

Now let’s get back to Eromanga Sensei. Eromanga is perfectly fine on a technical level and was made by people who although lazy, knew exactly what they were doing. The series knew it had an audience based on the success of Oreimo and sure enough was a decent hit in Japan. It was no mistake that Eromanga got made, rather a cynical decision to milk some cash out of the lolicon otakus. Eromanga in my mind is NOT worth celebrating. 


Story and Characters:


The story is about a light novel author named Izumi. He’s still in high school, but only cares about being a successful writer in the world of ero LNs. Izumi is extremely hardworking and prolific but is unfortunately a terrible writer. Izumi kind of acts as the avatar of series writer/director, Tsukasa Fushimi. Izumi’s novels only sell as well as they do thanks to his mysterious illustrator, who specializes in drawing lewd imagery. It turns out that this illustrator is Izumi’s obnoxious little step-sister named Sagiri. It ALSO turns out that their next-door neighbor is his arch rival in the world of erotic LNs. Izumi must try rise to the top of the ero LN world while also struggling with feelings of love for his step-sister. Basically, if you’ve seen Oreimo, you’ve seen Eromanga Sensei. If you’ve seen any of the dozens of shitty sibling incest echii, you’ve seen Eromanga sensei. 


Overall:


Eromanga Sensei isn’t funny. It isn’t erotic. It isn’t unique and amusingly bad. It’s just trite, boring, garbage. Well, at least it’s scratching an itch for loli lovers, right? Surely it features the most naked little girls of any anime in recent memory! Nope! Thanks to changes in Japan’s censorship laws over the last few years, there is no full-frontal nudity or unobscured rear-view nudity in the entire series. If you were hoping for something uniquely perverted, this isn’t it. Go watch Aki Sora instead. I have nothing further to say about this pile. It’s just this utterly mediocre echii with no reason to exist that you shouldn’t watch under any circumstances.

First of all, I do believe you shouldn't give any show a goddamn 1 from 10 score on review just because it has some tropes that you hate. 
Not to said I'm against someone voicing their opinion, but as we wrote a review here that the others gonna read and probably 'Influincing' them to watch or dropped a certain show, we should do our best to be as open-minded as possible. 
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Everyday we s̶t̶r̶a̶y̶ ̶f̶u̶r̶t̶h̶e̶r̶ ̶f̶r̶o̶m̶ ̶g̶o̶d̶'̶s̶ ̶l̶i̶g̶h̶t̶ get closer to jail. 
...JK lol. Long-ass reviews coming right noowww. (I'm not really good at english, tho', so hopefully you who decided to read this anywaycan understand what I wrote)


Well, When I first seen the trailer, what I had in thought was "So... Another of that infamous Oreimo? but they're not blood related? ...It's like a cue for the author to get wild this time lol. Still can't watch it, tho'". 


But damn I was wrong. The show is actually, even tho' it shares the same element with Oreimo, actually differs in theme and feels more light than Oreimo in some sense that even someone who's pretty much against watching an anime with incest as its main theme like me could actually enjoy. 


Just like one of the reviewer here said, the show introduces us to the otaku community (just like Oreimo), but this time, it's more specifically about Light Novel. It's not really a show with generic MC, where the big bro doing everything he can so he will able to bang his imouto (The guy even actually against incestual relationships), it also give us a little hindsight on what LN's Authors through before he could publish their works.  


It starts off with The Big Bro, Masamune, who wished he can see his lil' sis face again as after the incident where their parents died, She never going out from her bedroom again. 

It shows how dedicated the big bro in still taking care of her sister although just from the other side of the door. 

A lot happen and after some 'Accident', they found themselves to be closer than before. 


-Story: 7 

As I said, this kind of story already around since long time ago but it gave us a different theme from what's been around before (Imho). We really can think of this as OreImo v2, lol, but it really is different from it's big bro. 


-Art: 9 

Well, it's another A-1 masterclass. Not really my favorite studio but they really done a good job with the visuals. 


-Sound: 9 

ClariS song will always got 9 or 10 rating in my book lol. 

And the OP and ED is kind of adorable, too. 


-Character: 7 

The MC is a generic MC we can found in many anime, but what differs here is his mindset, where he really do love his Lil' sis, but he against the incestual relationships and still try to act as a proper big bro as best as possible (Even tho' they're not blood-related, but this is 'That' kind of show, so it can be expected they will ended up as couple in the end). 

And the main love interest too, Sagiri, is FCKING BETTER THAN KIRINO. Like She has that unique voice, ADORABLE LITTLE DANCE IN THE OP AND ED, not a bitch at all, and actually has a respect to his big bro. 

The other casts are pretty much really generic, that's why I give 7 scores in this category. Like, rival that ended up have a feelings for the MC, an easygoing boss, and so on. ...Except that one loli who said She loves 'D*ck'. It made me freeze on front of my computer for a few secs lol. It's the first time I seen this kind of scene not from hentai. 


-Enjoyment: 8 

Had many little giggling throughout the episodes. It's not the best anime I've watched, yeah, but it's still pretty enjoyable, too. The conversation between the characters weren't really as bland as what peoples pointing out, especially between Masamune and Sagiri. 


-Overall: 7 

If you enjoy a little lighthearted story, you might give this a chance. but this anime is certainly not for e̶l̶i̶t̶i̶s̶t̶ every audience, so try to watch at least 1 or 2 episodes before you decided to drop the show or not. 


And that's all from me. For you who actually read the review, hope you can understand what I typed. Hope I can see you sons of gun again. 


Next time.

I have a rule: I must sit through several (or all them if the series is done airing) episodes before writing a review or forming any sort of opinion and I try not to be quick to judge a series with a few rare exceptions. But oh goodness, please, forgive me, I couldn't, I simply couldn't take this anymore because I feel like my nerve cells were irreparably damaged. Anime is supposed to entertain, not shorten one's life.
Story: 3/10.
There is not much to say about it because I really cannot approve of a plot about a 13-year-old girl drawing lewd illustrations while her brother, ayoung novelist, pretty much allows it (despite a brief apology in the first episode). Yes, I am aware of how low the age of consent in Japan is, so this is my culture and mentality speaking here, but I fail to understand what's so entertaining about this, neither do I think it's okay just because the heroine is technically of age. This is downright unacceptable, as well as disgusting, and I am not willing to tolerate an anime that sexualizes minors and makes them say that they love, pardon me, dicks. To each their own, perhaps, but this anime is supposed to be a simple comedy yet it fails to find balance between risks and what can be considered funny and appropriate. Eromanga-sensei tries to be funny and fails on a scale so epic that it's practically cringe-worthy.

Now here is the thing: I actually enjoyed the first season of OreImo despite its risky themes. Yes, I see OreImo's flaws neither do I approve of Kirino's favorite genre and maybe things get worse later on, but at least OreImo was entertaining in comparison to whatever this circus is.


Art: 9/10.

Smooth animation and the fact that I like this show's art style are its only redeeming qualities, if you ask me.


Sound: 5/10.

Cutesy songs plus forgettable soundtrack. I always give this aspect 5 out of 10 when I cannot seem to remember anything, which means that there was nothing worth mentioning.


Character: 3/10.

I. Don't. Understand. Any of them. So here we have these two siblings-but-not-really as they are not related by blood, which is, apparently, an excuse to push their possibly romantic relationship down our throats. No, thank you. Masamune refers to Sagiri as his little sister, acknowledging her as one, so I do not think it's cute or funny. Not even a bit. These two are weird, painfully bland and boring and driven by horrible logic that is beyond my understanding. If it goes on like this, things will get out of hand. Of course, that's what this show is about, risky themes and relatively lewd semi-incest relationship between two kids and one of them just reached the age of consent (in accordance with Japanese laws, but most of us here still see her as a minor as we have our own laws to rely on).

Both Sagiri and her so-called brother are as blank as a sheet of paper. Masamune is a cheap copy Kyousuke Kosaka and has a personality of a toothpick. He is not believable or relatable and, as a result, it is almost impossible to like him because he doesn't make you feel anything. Sagiri, in the meantime, is laughable: a loli tsundere that, apparently, doesn't even know what the hell she wants. Infantile to the point of acting like a 6-year-old (she's 13), she is a cute but very annoying character and her adorable face does not count as a redeeming quality. Summing it up, both Masamune and his sister-but-not-really are ridiculously immature and unlikable. Given that they are protagonists of the series, that is not a way to go.

Don't get me started on the rest of the cast, Megumi Jinno in particular, someone needs to slap this girl once or twice, she collects friends like Pokemon and is too perverted for a 13-year-old. How is that funny? 


Enjoyment: 2/10.

This show is boring and sometimes it can be pretty confusing and downright disgusting and, as much as I'd like to be brave and believe that it gets better, I can't. Maybe it does, but I do not want to know.


I do not have any siblings, but I have friends who are like siblings to me and I cannot even imagine how or why a show like this can be considered funny. I gave it 3/10 and maybe, just maybe I am not harsh enough. I don't know if it gets better later on or not. But the truth is, I do not care much enough to be willing to figure that out. It's better to watch something else. What an utterly disgusting disappointment.

I'd like to start out by saying that I tried to read and respect the other users of this site's opinions, but it seems that everyone decided to watch one episode and call it garbage, or didn't even try to look past the lewded characters at all. It's sad that the number one most helpful review was someone trashing it because why not. People who gave it tens might have been over exaggerating, but giving it a one isn't fair to the show. The show does have lewded characters, but don't all animes have some sort of fan service? I don't understand how you couldrate it this harshly without realizing this fact. This may sound stupid, but the plot isn't always what decides whether an anime is great or not. It surely is a great contributing factor, but there are other things that make an anime fun to watch. First of all, I'd like to commend the great soundtrack of this show. I always sit and listen during the opening and ending, which I can't say I do for every show. To me, good ops and eds can make a show much better, being the hype in the beginning and the satisfying, familiar song at the end. The art is also amazing, and very appealing to the eyes. I will say that the shows plot isn't A+, but it's a rom-com, guys. The story is about the main character and the girls who surround him. It isn't meant to be full of action and adventure, it's meant to make you laugh and watch on as everyone becomes closer. If you want to watch a story with plot, Jojo is always there for you to watch. And obviously the age of the females in the show is a tad too low, but it's not like they emphasize on that. I'm always satisfied at the end of each episode and would recommend this to anyone and everyone reading. Please give this anime a chance, and try to remember that not every anime is a plot filled tear jerker, and that some are made to be enjoyed for what they really are.

Eromanga-sensei is the portrait of an unusual comedy that plays with the morbid side of the mind. Moreover, the show salvages some ideas from other anime in search of acceptance. In the end, Eromanga-sensei only offers an unsatisfaction with an overused harem story and with some misleading sexual concepts.
The average: The anime started with a promising 8.23 and ended with a miserable 6.97. The 12 years old girl sexual behaviour. The silly and unrealistic story. 
The good: Some hilarious moments and few characters.
Perhaps, the biggest mistake is the story. Even if we eliminate the infamous incest debate, we end up with an empty harem story.A laddie with a collection of girls between the ages of twelve and fifteen who fall in love with the protagonist, an overused story romance in the anime world. To deceive the viewer with a new plot, an erroneous perception is created in which this promiscuous group is as functional as any group of adults to the extreme where they are most successful and can take their own decisions that are not in accordance with their ages. No one has ever asked, ¿where are the adults in this series? So far you will notice two, but they are mere puppets who try to propel dysfunctional relationships. The show portrays three young characters (Masamune, Elf and Muramasa) who are famous light novels writers and a twelve-year-old lassie (Sagiri) who is an erotic sketcher known as Eromanga-sensei. The irony is that this lassie, despite her alleged inexperience has developed sexual tastes or fetishes out of nuffink that can not be explained logically and credibly. To play a little more with your mind, this lassie lives with the laddie. In addition, she is his sister, but with a small countermeasure, she is a step-sister. For some persons they can hook together for others could be a problem. It is up to you which one is your side. 


Let's remove the sexual part for a bit because I need to be honest. The show is full of incoherency even for a comedy. ¿Are you going to believe that this little lassie locked herself in her room without any visual contact and this laddie never even bothered entering and see if she was ok? ¿Will you laugh after seeing a child, kid, youth locked in a room for several months without any visual contact? I bet that MOST all the persons will take the door down and see if the kid is ok or will try to seek help immediately. Don't play with our intelligence that argument is so lame that none will bite for it. Also, the irrational success case of the characters (they have published novels, and some have sold more than a professional writer).


Now the sexual part, the main topic of the comedy. In one hand,  the relationship concept misleading the meaning of relationship or "romance" expressed in the constant sexual insinuation of a twelve years old girl. I need to repeat it, a twelve years old girl. The continuous  story twist hidden under the timid face of a kid "Brother,  you are an idiot and a pervert" twist "I want Elf's panties." Scenes that play with the morbid desires of the mind, pushed by every panty angle in search of spectators. Second, the sexual misleading "you are a pervert, but I like drawing erotic scenes" or "Can I see your penis?" Third, the overused harem concept. All these ideas continuously resemble the fetishism introduced in this anime, and if you don't like them, then you will feel this anime as an immediate failure. I am not saying that this anime is a total waste, there are some exciting scenes and they could have used that scenes a bit more (final episode 9).


About the characters, nothing is relevant. A guy and lots of lolis that love him or want to have a relationship with him. Most all them are more successful than any adult, and some have unexplained sexual desires. If we let Sagiri's relation out of the spectrum then we can appreciate some characters like the promiscuous and introvert personality of Elf Yamada to the timid and polite nature of Muramasa but sadly if we add Sagiri to the equation, Masamune's relations are unbalanced and in some cases forced. 


The art isn't bad. The definition of the characters was good. However, you will enjoy it just if you like the story if not the art will be irrelevant. 


The OP and ED songs are good. The OP was part of the J-Pop Billboard and the Oricon ranking. About the score, it is simple and matches the comedy moments.   


Finally, I don't suggest this anime for kids. It has some sexual concepts that aren't explained and can lead to a misconception if you don't understand the difference between the joke and the reality.

This is easily the most enjoyable Anime of the season.  So much so that I want to go back and watch all the episodes up to the current one again right now.  First I want to preface this by saying, there is a lot of hate towards this show by really retarded people.  Before I even began watching the show, I knew what I was expecting to see.  The description is very clear, and knowing the mind behind it, if you don't want to see the new "sibling romantic comedy" then you shouldn't even begin watching in the first place.In real life, I don't purposely go looking for things I would hate and put hours of my time, effort, and energy into them.  If you understand that this will be an incest comedy, which it doesn't even try to hide being, then you will enjoy your experience with this show, if not, just go watch something more to your liking.  


I really enjoy everything about this show.  I also enjoyed OreImo, but this one is completely different.  I guess it's because in OreImo there was a feeling that the main character might choose a different girl, and in fact the arc where he dated Kuroneko was one of my favorite parts of that series.  In this show, it seems that all the side characters are firmly supportive of the Masamune/Sagiri ship.  In OreImo, you had some pretty serious competition for the main character, with each of the girls wanting to get a piece of the action.  So unlike the harem aspect of that series, this one is much more of a romance anime.  The characters are all likeable.  The least likeable is Elf, but after learning more about her, you will warm up to her as well.


Sagiri is one of the most adorable characters you will ever encounter in anime.  She is certainly not equatable to any real life human, so don't expect  to find anyone in real life that resembles her.  As Masamune comments, Sagiri is more of a fairy like, almost ethereal character.  On one hand she is so innocent, yet on the other, she is a complete pervert.  But one thing is for sure, if I were to ever have a little sister, I would want her to be just like Sagiri.  Tempermental, but not so ridiculously cartoonishly tsundere.  You can really feel the genuine love she has, even if she can't really express it properly.


The main character, although clearly a siscon, also has the restraint to not want to pursue those feelings.  There is a morality that keeps him in check.  Yet being able to pour those feelings into his "love letter" of a story which apparently is so genuine that it would bring a reader to tears, it is a sweet thing to see the closeness developing between brother and sister who are destined to be together.  If this series were to end with them not being together in some way, shape, or form it would be a complete travesty.  


I don't think that there is anything wrong with non blood related "family members" having a relationship in real life.  Love is a strange thing and it's not two people's fault that their parents ended up in a relationship.  That happening should not make them having romantic feelings for one another something to be ashamed of.  Obviously two blood related family members should not pursue a relationship in real life.  However, despite my wanting Kuroneko to prevail in OreImo, I was still 100% behind Kirino being with her brother once she finally admitted her feelings.  


Once again, if you aren't going to flip your script over the "sibling romance", then you will love this show.  Very cute girls, great comedy, and overall a wonderful experience which will make you fall in love if you'll let it.  If you know you can't get past the premise of the show, don't willingly slit your wrists and cry to us while bleeding.  It just shows that you are childish and only care about people listening to you complain.  I hate country music, so, knowing that a music festival will feature all country music, you wouldn't catch me dead there... the same rule applies here.  Watch it if you are open minded and you will not regret it, it will no doubt become one of your favorites from this year.


PS As a side note, the top commenter who tries to trash this Anime is incorrect in saying that Sagiri is 10, because she is in fact 13.  I'm not sure if that is her age in the Light Novel or not, but considering this is a discussion of the anime in which she is 13, their point is invalid about claiming that the sexualization of her character is promoting pedophilia. Whether you agree with it or not, 13 is the legal age of consent in Japan.  This may seem "horrible" to some people, but even in parts of the US a person can get married as young as age 12.  If you don't believe me, feel free to look up the legal marriage ages across the US yourself.  Without parental consent a girl can marry at age 15 in Mississippi.  With parental consent, a girl can get married at age 13 in New Hampshire and 12 in Massachusetts.  Even more interesting is that there is no restriction on age of marriage in Mississippi as long as there is parental consent.

Personally, this anime is actually pretty decent when it first started, but when I try to compare its later episode, where are of his harem came together, It became quite uninteresting, and even, unengaging when a certain episode is dedicated to a certain girl in his harem. Even if that includes your favorite show. Konosuba is one, they lewd Megumin. Tbh, it should be pretty normal to see such a thing in thiscommunity that you've gotten involved in. You may also hate this show for the somewhat revolutionary idea of romance of legal incest story, that being said, no one are going to make an actual romance of that IRL, so what's the big deal. I live in the same circumstances as this, not blood related sister and shit, if you see her as your sister, no sane person (ones that have a sister) who even want to hook up with them as a lover or as a love interest. That's only in anime and stuff from the ancient times, where King arthur fall in love with his mother without both knowing that they are related, and got kill for it or something along those line. Or, tribes, emperors, king practicing that lineage thing, where only blood related sibliings or descedent can make love and reproduce in order to keep that, idk, snobbish tradition of treating a certain blood as a part of the royalty, or being special and superior in a way from other human beings. And ofc, Eromanga is different because she's not blood related, but the general theme of the genre is the same.


This quality of animation is undeniably of a pretty high quality. The characters are consistently well drawn, and their designs or character are detailed and consistent through and through (we barely see the camera angle zoomed, or angled from afar for a very long duration). It's hard to bring in subjectivity, the way you felt about the show, and lesser the quality of the art/animation through subjectivity, in order to justify a 1/10 or even lower for the art/animation of the show. In order to explain how shit this show really is. It's irrational to take irrationality (subjectivity) and apply it to rational things such as art. Art are obviously something that we all can agree on. If something looks good and well drawn, that's a good quality art. some people tries to bend logic or idea of artistic around, to push their bias view that pampered to their own irrationality and subjective feelings, over evaluating things with a certain degree of maturity and objectivity in it. The evaluation on the story are entirety subjective, though, it's hard to say the same if you are going to evaluate the external content of the anime, like the art, music, voice acting, animation (the amount of frame to frame picture that is drawn to make the animation looks smooth or not smooth) and so on. And some scene in this is actually smooth as hell. There are some cartoonish art style here and there to charaterized the character (like when sagiri do popeye looking mouth thing). And the lewd of fanservice is justified, look at the fucking title name mate. 


Eromanga sensei is a very fun show for its early 5 episodes and so; though, I kinda lost interest once there's this trip event in the show, as the entirety of his harem grouped up, indicating signs of wanting to be his love interest to one another (basically to their rivals in romance). I mean, it's cool how at least this anime, unlike many other harem, are extremely honest about their feeling for the MC, and even be as bold to confess their love. And this is through the used of scenery, or subtle ways of confessing, and other dramatic elements to make that scene of the confession, less boring and more romantic than any other harem series that I've seen. 


That being said, there are quite a myriad of negatives when it comes to the approach, the method of developing a character, and the overly clicheness of the anime, where the show tries to be different, but done it in a pretty half assed way.


As we all know, a cliche harem show is basically a show where there's only one guy with multiplicity of women, who are seeking to fight one another (though, they will still care about one another either way as a friend) just to hook up with the MC, depending on the route that the anime may take for each or all girls. I'm actually pertaining to the VN of any harem series, that tend to contain a harem route, or a route that solely focused specifially on one candidate of the MC's harem. This being said, the anime tries to bring in at least other male character that seem to have no interest in girls, or bring in some random dudes into the story, pretending to be different from other harem show that we've seen. The pretentious part here isn't the fact that this anime have other males in it, ones that who are close to the MC and in a position to communicate with people from the MC's harem that is. The pretentious part here is bringing him out of nowhere, be a part of the different event that they took place in (like the beach episode), then forcely or conveniently put him away, making his existence seem quite unneeded. It's as if he wasn't even needed in the show but they just decided to keep him there anyway. There's no point of having him take part in a certain activities with the MC and of his harem, when you're going to get rid of him during it anyway (talking about the King's game screen, the game where you draw a number, and tell them to do whatever you want). 


The approach of the harem is done quite horribly, it's not to say that this anime is bad as a whole for creating this horrible harem after all of the harem are introduced. It's just their way of presenting and giving only a little bits of moment for the MC and the girl of interest for a very short moment. It doesn't progresses to anything much, though, it might have created a reaction from the MC, but that either stagnated just to add in some dramatic scene in the episode, or to make the girls became even more competitive in becoming the MC's love interest. And his love for his little sister is a barrier for the MC to not hook up with other women, just like the very popular meme, "I love emilia" scene, rip Rem.




On a side note, you also call any author of such medium like a manga writer, light novel writer etc as sensei in the otaku community (everyone calls them that, see the anime man interviews with spice of wolf author, or konosuba author, or shirobako and bakuman, an anime on the production making of manga and anime industry). 


The actual story maybe about that rivaly thing in regards to being an author and all. So it's not weird for the story to be about it, but the anime neglected this aspect, and proceeds on towards the typical harem moment rather than focusing more so on the main aspect of the story, and that's, striving for success in the industry (mainly for the MC's case since other authors are more successful than him). And anime move the plot quite slowly as well, that's prolly a down side of the show if you hate seeing characters spending time together (having fun), and developing some kind of a relationship with those interactions. It's pretty slice of life-ish if I were to describe it.


The anime followed a typical template of a typical harem show, though that's not a negative of the show, since every story in other community does the same. Deadpool for example, it follows the exact same template like any typical hero shows, and the hero's journey (the infamous outline for hero's story that everyone accidentally followed). The matter of criticizing the show here is how it was done, and how do you like it personally. This part is really subjective to one's taste, since people expect different things from a story, and our definition of entertainment are never entirely the same. 


And that being said, this show has a great start, the quality drops though from its early episodes once all the harem is introduced, however, this is not a bad show. There are a number of negatives and positive in this show. But tbh, this show is pretty cute and fanservice heavy it maybe, it's a fucking fanservice show on premature girls and that isn't new at all in the otaku community. It's for a very niche audience that likes it. If you hate people lewding premature girls, hearing them saying lewd things like, "I want to see your panties", "all girls my age love dicks" etc. This anime is not for you.

---Story---


It's understandable to see people not liking it, because its really cliche at this point. But for those who say "its OreImo" no its not. I didnt even enjoy OreImo a bit. It was boring. Especially the second season. Story telling was bad, characters felt hollow. I didnt read the novels for OreImo but for anime it just felt like, they found a scene from it to make one ep, then found a completely different thing in it then made another ep from it. Story was really slow on that one. But in this one its really fun, I read the novels for Eromanga and they are really follow the novel well. Novel's story telling is great, and in anime they made it great too.


---Art---


Art is good, but its not detailed. Not like I want a detailed art from this kind of series though. 


---Sound---


It's great. It doesnt feel like its a comedy soundtrack for a serious moment like it does for modern anime (check Saijaku Muhai) For anime ED and OP 

both of them are great.


---Character---


Now I dont understand the complaints here. None of these characters feel hollow except for Tomoe, but she doesnt have enough screen-time for it anyways. Characters are great. I wont talk each of them here, but heres an example. MC doesnt feel like he doesnt have a life other than the screen-time he has for example. Sure it isnt realistic but this isnt like Berserk or Steins;Gate really. It's a romantic comedy. 



---Enjoyment---


I'm quite happy that I finally found an anime that I can watch it without getting bored. It's been a while since I enjoyed an anime this much, I cant really explain it well, sure heroine is good looking but when they dont show her that much this anime is still fun. 


---Overall---


go watch it

Let's see.. there are different types of people in the anime community. Therefore its only natural that there is going to be differences, usually more than there are similar viewpoints. I think this statement is quite evident in a lot of mainstream anime and especially anime like Eromanga-sensei.
Eromanga-sensei is this anime that circulates around the idea of enjoyment in terms of "Shallow" entertainment. The goal for the show is to tick off the viewer's sense of humor albeit by the previously referred "Shallow" factors.
Ecchi, recently popular Loli characters and something that started to catch the attention of that certain group people who are suitable viewersof this show, Incestual-like relationships, are the few factors that are accompanied by the awkward humor of this show. The show will project enjoyment upon the viewers in such a way that you can't find in more insightful anime with plot, not "plot".\n\n
I feel that the answer to one of the major questions asked of this show is that you have to come to watch this show with certain expectations. Because this show will not respond to your senses like a seinen or a thriller. You have  to basically do this if you are to get anything out of this show: Turn off the critical side of yours and try to put your empty mind into watching the show. Then and then only will your mind be filled with the things that the show wants you to be full of. It wants the viewers to have fun without focusing on finer details (but there are fun easter eggs at times ;))\n\n
Yes, so basically to wrap this horribly bad review, this is what Eromanga-sensei is about: Mindless fun. Its no no different than many other famous anime of the same build.If you can't have some of the Mindless fun, Eromanga-sensei is not for you as it doesn't appeal to your expectations.

This show exceeded my expectations in every single aspect. It was an enriching experience from start to finish and I can't advocate for your viewership enough. Don't misunderstand me; this show is absolute fucking garbage - but it traverses past the point of being an ironically enjoyable experience to a point of unironic, earnest enjoyment.
Slowly and surely, I began to board the bandwagon upon realizing this fact of life. At some point, you begin to accept that this is no mere sub-par show. You soon realize that this redefines what can be considered "bad". This show takes garbage to new territory.
Though, all bias aside, froma critical standpoint, the art is visually pleasing - it really stands above as a cut above the rest in terms of visually aesthetic and is lacking in flaws. The sound design and original soundtrack created for this anime worked to it's benefit and sounds quite nice, from the masterful opening that encapsulates the spirit of the show, to the ending that pumps you up for the next episode, and everything in between.


Continuing our critical analysis, the story is not the greatest - it has unique elements in the mainstream realm of anime but is nothing very special. It would stand at a solid 5 from a macroscopic perspective, assuming you only consider the overall basic, core plot. If you were to look at the more nuanced mini-arcs of this series, that perception would quickly fade, and you would soon realize that this show's plot is beyond the realm of a mere 1/10. It is much, much, much worse. They add in needless drama for the sake of extending the series and the flow is terrible. One might say - it is garbage.


But for a moment - indulge in the sheer beauty of this show through a perspective of how garbage this show really is - Eromanga-sensei stands to testify how an anime can be both objectively bad - but still be an immensely enjoyable experience. As to avoid spoiling any of the series, I will leave you with this final request.


Please watch the show.

Eromanga-sensei is an insult to the medium. Everyone has their own tastes and that is fine if you want to make a show about an incestuous relationship then I would have just moved on. It is not the premise of the show that is the problem. Eromanga-sensei could not be more cookie cutter if it tried to be.
Story:
Basically OreImo but this time they are half siblings (implicitly from the very beginning). MC is your generic shouting bland guy, little sister is a bi-polar loli. The story starts off being mildly interesting but eventually deteriorates into contrived reasons for different characters to be in provocative positions.
Art:
Thepalate is generic cutesy colours and the characters are all designed to make you think they are cute. The art is quite jarring as the forced cuteness really just makes it feel emotionless, like a randomly generated character was created by picking cute features out of a hat.


Sound:

I don't really have much to say about the sound. It wasn't bad and it wasn't outstanding, it just served its purpose.


Character:

Character dynamics start out quite interesting, but quickly deteriorate into just being another excuse for the fanservice. It is less like the characters are creating a narrative through their interactions and personalities and more that they become whoever the story needs that single person to be. The characters themselves (besides their physical features) have no distinguishing qualities about them. The only memorable character is the loli sister who is a walking contradiction, it's almost like the anime is trying to make fun of people with traumas in their life.


Enjoyment:

I can find no enjoyment in this anime. The setting is boring, the characters aren't characters but vehicles for fanservice, the story is a vehicle for fanservice. The worst part is that the fanservice isn't even that good, the attempt at a moe style hinders the amount of sexiness that could be conveyed.


Overall:

I started by claiming that this was an insult to the medium, that isn't because it is fanservice anime, there is plenty good fanservice anime. It is an insult because it is a very clear cash grab. Seeing that people relatively enjoyed OreImo this has been created to pander to the same crowd. I did not like OreImo but at least I could say it was an interesting show, the characters were well defined and the story had some substance. Eromanga-sensei takes that and does away with it all so we can see more fanservice of little sisters.


If I were to describe how I feel about this show it would be that it is the type of show I feel a computer would generate. It is devoid of any sort of passion or effort and so feels soulless. It feels like an anime fresh off the mass production line. If you want to watch a show about somewhat cutesy girls in attempted sexy positions and don't really care about plot then please ignore me and enjoy to your heart's content.


Elsewise 1/10 I would recommend actively avoiding.
