To start off the show has really generic and boring characters that go through almost no development and don't grow or change throughout the "story" of the show. I would say more about them except I can't remember a damn thing about any of them that's how forgettable they are. The story is basically nonexistent as it really just focuses on the competition between the dull characters' light novels and has no resolution or ending. The show ends on what is essentially a filler episode which is really jarring and itmade it feel like the show just didn't end. The show is also dependent on a bunch of really bad and intrusive fanservice that adds nothing to the characters or the story. From a visual standpoint this show looks awful. Sure there may be some interesting color choice on some of the characters occasionally but that's about it, the show feels like an abridged series there are a lot of shots with just lip flaps and no animation on the characters themselves and overall the show just feels lifeless in the animation like it was phoned in. The sound is almost as bad as the visuals the songs are really unfitting and just come out of nowhere they do nothing to enhance the scenes they are in and are really forced and distracting. I originally was going to put my enjoyment higher because I watched this show with friends in a "so bad its good" way, but to be honest the scenes where any of us were genuinely surprised by and laughing were few and far between since much of the show was just boring conversations and we ended up bored for most of it so I wouldn't even recommend watching this ironically. Just stay as far away from this show as you possibly can

There is a common theme among anime where a controversial show will get utterly destroyed by those who disliked it, and showered with unadulterated praise by those who enjoyed it. This leads, on this site anyway, to the lovers and haters blasting 1s and 10s - both of which are just wrong and uncalled for. Let me explain.
This show is not a 1; there are a few redeeming qualities the show possesses and it is far from the worst anime out there. It isn't a 10 either - the characters are mostly bland, the story is barebones with some poor arcs, and the art isflawed at times. I can't be "objective" as such because a review is subjective personal opinion, but I won't be hyperbolic either, so let me give my take.


For starters, Story and Characters. To my mind, the main cast of characters are mostly a pick-n-mix of reasonably well-put-together but standard tropes, doing nothing innovative but not really ruining the show either... rather than the horrid, insulting, instantly dislikable cast I was led to believe going into this. Masamune is alright as a struggling but motivated young author, driving what little plot there is with gusto; Elf Yamada is a decent rival, and friend, tsundere character who gets some surprisingly emotional moments at times. Muramasa arrives later but became my favourite character with a good background and well-paced story arc.


Then come the bland and underdeveloped characters... Sagiri is a cute,quiet girl who loves drawing and her step brother... and that's basically her entire character, unfortunately; Ayame gets almost no screen time and just as little development; Megumin is a middle schooler who "loves dicks" and hates Sagiri being a shut-in. The characters are a mixed bag with some decent flavours and some bland and some outright crappy ones, but most of them didn't leave me with a bad taste in my mouth and I did enjoy several of the character arcs and the primary story arc of Masamune's efforts to publish his works., but the story is so barebones it doesn't push anything, and there are several arcs that fall flat completely.


Something important to acklowledge: I feel like I must point out two things regarding the so called "incest". One, they are not blood related - doesn't matter how you slice it, they aren't incestuous. So the romance here does not bother me at all. If it bothers you a lot, well this show is not for you, but it does not bother me so it does not factor into my view of the characters. Two, there's fanservice aplenty but there is zero nudity or lovemaking. The aforementoned fanservice is actually far less graphic and much less frequent than I was led to believe too, although it does get considerably more audacious towards the end of the series.


The Art and animation is fine, with a few highlights and some flawed works here and there. There's not a huge amount of sakuga in a show like this of course, but the environments and characters are mostly well-drawn; there's some awkward bits every so often, like Sagiri's calves being drawn really off in the opening title, but it's never obnoxiously bad enough to cringe, and some of the later episodes' environments and character animation are pretty enough to make up for the lapses in quality.


The sound design and animation was the highlight for me. The voice actors do their parts very well to my ear - although I do not speak Japanese so take that with a grain of salt - and the opening and ending themes are both catchy, upbeat and enjoyable. There is some great sound design with odd elements too, like commercials, although it never has enough brilliant detail or quality to dazzle me. It's very good overall though and the opening theme in particular is a new favourite of mine.


Basically this anime was, to me, very simple to summarise. A sometimes funny, somewhat awkward little series with some great sound and voice acting, some nice but flawed animation, hit and miss characters and a servicable but barely-there story. It's not nearly the creepy fetish-fest you may have been informed of, but there's nothing particularly memorable either, opening song aside. I enjoyed this anime more than I disliked it, but I also doubt I'd ever bother watching it again. Give it a shot and see what you make of it.

Spoiler-free review.
How to start about this... this is one of those shows you must watch alone and try not to think about how sad your life is because you are watching and enjoying it. If this was a live action show it would be banned world-wide, we are talking about a harem show full of 12 years old, with mild nudity and fucked up characters. But lets go step by step.
Art: 8/10. Very good and polished animation quality, movements and facial expressions are good. Opening and ending are cute, specially the dance parts. VO is also well done if it wasn't because the characters theyportray are crap, but still good. There were a few reused scenes and weirdly-drawn characters on some frames.


Story: 3/10. Not sure if it can even be called an story, a crappy light novel writer is working on climbing on the light novel scene and finds out the artist that was drawing his illustrations is his 12 year old little sister, which is a perverted hikikomori that draws erotic illustrations for a living. From there, more 12 years old show up to try to claim the main character's dick in a ridiculous, cringy and unrealistic way. Basically the author sexualizes the shit out of them all, sometimes during the show I almost forgot I was seeing 12 years old because of that, and then felt disgusted about myself and the creator of this. From there on is just your typical harem show, there is the fireworks episode, the beach episode, the TOURNAMENT ARC episode, and many other meaningless shit, because the main story seems to time-jump randomly to their milestones without really showing what happened (episode 11). That and the amount of coincidences that made me facepalm multiple times, specially on the relationship between the 2 main characters.


Characters: 2/10. Probably the worst part of it all. Let's remember again that we are talking about 12 year old girls, alright, now give them the most plain and predictable personalities ever (the tsundere imouto, the foreign blond ojou-sama, the traditional and shy ninja-girl, the genki classmate who tries to look older than she is), and now make them disgusting (the imouto is actually a perverted hikikomori that sexually harrases the other 12yo girls, the ojou-sama is actually an exhibitionist with an 8th grade syndrome, the samurai-girl loves the main character's crappy novels for no reason at all, the genki girl says she loves dicks and tries to act perverted). Alright, now think of the most stupid and plain main character you could ever think of (works hard, is kind to everyone, a bit shy, is good doing the chores, is clueless about love stuff) and make it also disgusting (basically he sexualizes 12 yo girls and is trying to fuck his little sister). And finally, make every character love the main character  for no reason at all. Yep, we got everything in one place. That's pretty much the cancer of the show, every character is ridiculously plain with stupid or unexplained motivations, and disgusting personalities for their age, BUUUTT!!!...


Enjoyment: 9/10. I am ashamed to say I enjoyed the show. Despite the awful story and characters, the show hooks you and you find yourself wanting more, because we all are awful beings inside, and this show plays with it. I found myself smiling at many scenes, I wanted to see more, it's like a morbid feeling, like being near an accident and peeking over the crowd to see the dismembered bodies. You are aware it is disgusting, you feel like you are disgusting, but you just can't stop watching. This is the reason I gave this show a 7, because despite of everything I said above, not many shows with such huge flaws make you keep watching.


Overall: 7/10. You won't obtain anything from watching this other than plain entertainment, and feeling bad about yourself enjoying it. This is not art, this is like a kebab, you eat it, its delicious, you know its not healthy, but you keep eating, sauce keeps oozing from the kebab, your hands, your legs, your face, you are all covered in disgusting sauce, but you enjoy it a lot and you keep munching the goddamn piece of meat, because you don't think about what you are eating, but how good it makes you feel. When you are done the regrets come, but you know you will be ordering another one as soon as you get the chance.


And again, WATCH IT ALONE.

What do you expect out an anime from A-1 Pictures? Interesting characters, well qualified art design, or a good plot? With their infamous hit Sword Art Online and other well known shows Blue Excorist and Erased, they have been making average shows for us to enjoy, right? Unfortuantly, I couldn't believe this is the best work they could pull off after earning so much profit to this day.
Eromanga Sensei is suppose to be a Romantic, Comedy, Slice of Life, and Lewd show about a Older Brother living alone with his Little Step-Sister. Before discussing the story, let's talk about how their genre was impulsive forthis show.


Romance, it's a complicated word, but once you put into a story, you could either agree or disagree of how people could love one another. This show doesn't define that very well, rather, they try to make lewd jokes to have the characters have some sort of bonding moment, but it's quite ridiculous if that's how you think this could be satisfying to watch when all you could think about is, "Is the Brother even going to fall in with this one? How about this one?" What's with all the girl characters loving the main boy character? Is it his looks, passion, kindness, or his strength? We never got to know, they just say "I love you because of this reason only." And that reason wouldn't exactly relate to his character. Finally, you would immediately realize in this show, the sister has a crush on the Brother, for whatever reason. Seriously, what is it? Is it the time spending together? No, because the sister is a shut in and never talked to her brother till now. What's even worse is that The Brother also does have a crush on her, WHY?!? Is it her... you know what, it doesn't matter, this show tried to think this is acceptable, but really, it's just ludicrous


Comedy, it can be funny if this were your type of humor. If you're into embrassing moments, you'll laugh your butt off, because that's the comedy. "Is it, that can't true... I watched Oriemo from A-1 and I laugh so hard, milk started squirting out of my nose!" Shamefully enough this is the best they can come up with, and it's not quite entertaining when you feel like it's forcing the characters to do interapproriate activities to get the audiences attention. I didn't get a laugh out of it once, because it was too bashful. Especially when you make a joke about a ten year old loving a penis.


Slice of Life is just an excuse to make people think, "Man, if this could happen in real life, I want to be part of that!" Guess what, overall this show shouldn't even exist compared to reality. It refuses to take any of it serious if it were to even try. I think I've said enough about this.


If you want Lewd, go watch a show about teenagers, not middle schoolers. Oreimo wasn't too much on the lewd side until it reached Season 2, which was acceptable. This isn't Oriemo, this is about middle schoolers. You could see that this show loves to show the girls bottoms as it makes its camera angles in each shot, i turn my head away because I was looking at a 10 year olds ass. I don't know why people thought it was a good idea to show lewd animations about little girls taking showers while showing off their bodies. It's disgusting.


The Story is plain simple, The brother wants to become a successful novelist, in order to do that, he needs to publish another title for his career. You don't get to see how they do it, or why they thought that the ideas of making one (thank god), because the story was an excuse just so you can see the sister draw lewd pictures, see girls hanging out with the main character to flirt around, and excuse after excuse... 


I compare this show to Oriemo, because it copies the relationship with the characters, their interest, how they made friends, and involving a twist with the little sister revealing a suprsing secret. I don't want this to feel like a rip off of Oriemo because Oriemo actually had an idea, it didn't turned out good until the end, but it's entertainment was enjoyable to watch. Eromanga Sensei didn't make anything original, rather, it was a whole cliché just so you can fantasize being in a relationship with these characters, it's disturbing to think about. 


This show deserves a 4, I didn't ask for more, but I did ask for a better plot.

This show is unfortunately suffering from a less than desirable premise, but doesn't really deserve the treatment it gets. I went into Eromanga Sensei hearing only terrible things from my die-hard anime-loving friends, and from the general consensus on twitter and various social media websites. Allow me to preface this review by saying I watched this anime, much like I watched Oreimo years prior, going with a clear mind. I knew nothing of Oreimo's premise, but knew of Eromanga's going in. I may make comparisons with Oreimo throughout this review, which is to be expected considering the two anime share a creator.
With that being said,lets get into things. Eromanga Sensei is essentially another story of a brother who really cares for his younger sister, even though on the outside it doesn't seem like she cares much for him. Right off the bat, you can tell the dynamic you'll have between your two main characters, and just where the story will go from there. The younger sister is distant and gives her caring brother a hard time, but this of course changes as the story progresses. We learn that these two are step siblings, the mother in the equation having died prior to the start of the series. Our brother character is 15, and our sister is 12. 


What really attracted me to Oreimo 2 when it came out, of course a while after I'd seen Oreimo and figured out I was in for an "Incest" plot, was to see just how the writer could justify to his audience why they should get behind a brother and sister getting together. I may have absolutely hated Kirino as a character and rooted on as Kyousuke dated Kuroneko hoping against hope that we'd get the later pairing. Of course, we didn't, and I along with thousands of other viewers were left unsatisfied with the ending and a bit upset, so I kept that in mind while starting Eromanga Sensei. I didn't want to go in thinking there was a chance that everything could go perfectly right from a viewer's stand point...but I was shockingly shown otherwise. I wanted to be challenged, I wanted my views on incest challenged. I wanted the creator of the show to give me what I desperately seeked in Oreimo - a story that was able to justify one of the most taboo things our species identifies.


With Oreimo he failed, but with Eromanga Sensei, he succeeded. Now, I don't per se accept incest among blood related family members, but when it's among two people with no relation to one another except for growing up together in the same home and being around one another's parent, I can open myself up to acceptance if a story is told well enough, and the story in Eromanga Sensei did that. I didn't find myself angered over a tsundere lead that didn't deserve what she got while a cast of much nicer characters were thrown to the side. Oreimo felt wrong, and Eromanga Sensei felt oh-so-right.


Masamune could end up with Sagiri, Megumi, Elf, or Muramasa, and it would feel like an appropriate ending in this story. It doesn't hinge upon the 'incest is wincest' ending like Oreimo did, but it would be great if that is where they went or if they went in any other direction. I will openly admit that I marathoned the show 24 hours before the writing of this review, and before that, I knew nothing of this story. I don't know how it ends in the light novels and manga, I am just going squarely off of what the anime showed. I didn't think I was going to be in for something that I enjoyed more than Oreimo, but was very glad that I did. This show took the "sibling romance" genre and finally gave it the story it deserved, all while sprinkling a great amount of humor, character development, fan service, and art throughout. 


This show looked a lot better than I expected it to, had great voice acting and good use of sound effects, and some of my favorite characters in quite sometime. The show ended too abruptly for some, but I really understood the conclusion they went for. Sagiri allowed Elf and Muramasa into her room, effectively joined them in an intimate setting, and finally made friends. It wasn't Eromanga Sensei who they became friends with, it was Sagiri herself. The very last few moments of the show had Sagiri leaning out her window to say goodbye to Elf and Muramasa herself, showing she'd grown as a character and was able to take a step to help get past tragedy in her life. I think this easily set up a second series, and was the perfect close to her current character arc.


I recommend that if you're on the fence about Eromanga Sensei, you give it a try. Don't listen to what other people have to say about it, negative or positive, just dive right in. It'll be an enjoyable experience if you keep your mind open and expect to have your preconceived notions challenged. That's what you should want from your media, something compelling that makes you really question what you believe is right.

My opinion, of course.
Eromanga-sensei - one of the most popular non-sequels during the season of Spring 2017. The light novel was by the same author as the popular series OreImo, and both share the fact that there is a relationship between a brother and a sister. It has gained a lot of supporters, and also a lot of haters.
Let me get this straight: Masamune and Sagiri are not actual siblings. They're step-siblings, as their parents (Masamune's father and Sagiri's mother) got married many years after giving birth to both of them. So you don't really have to worry about the incest, or you can ignoreit.


Eromanga-sensei is meant to be a comedy anime, and it does that well. But in terms of actual plot, it fails at that. Some of the decisions made by the production seem really hard to understand, it can get a little nonsensical. It does go in a bit on how to write a story and gain ideas, however. The story seems a little hard to believe with many coincidences and the fact that all the major characters are teenagers, and they are all light novel writers and an artist. The backstory may be interesting because of this. I disliked the overall execution as it didn't feel smooth to me, with sudden breaks to fanservice episodes and then backstories...


Consistent art and good animation, have to give it to A-1. It is very colourful and pleasing to the eye. Character designs are easy to distinguish from each other and nicely designed.


The music is great, with theme songs by ClariS and TrySail, and nice background music as well. The voice actors are also really good at expressing their character, with distinguishable voices that suit their character very well. Their voices add on to the comedic power of this anime.


Although the different characters all have their own personalities, I do not think I found much character development as the story progressed. The relationships between these characters aren't all that complex, with pretty much all the female characters harbouring crushes on Masamune. This anime does not go very in-depth on the characters and nor does it make you think.


The atmosphere is very light-hearted at all times, and I don't think there is ever a time where you feel any drama or seriousness going on. Tons of fanservice, most things that were started failed to be resolved. You may be able to find it cute or sweet about how Masamune confesses to Sagiri and how some of the characters are not afraid to come out about their feelings. It may be a bit of a downer as well to some about how they are step-siblings, either because you wish they were actual siblings, or feel like it is still a taboo subject regardless of whether they are actually blood-related or not. It might be a bit strange or awkward to some. How they came to fall for each other was probably the worst done part, it felt rushed and hard to believe.


I don't think this is the worst show that you should all hate on, which some people are doing probably to jump on some bandwagon, but it is also not a very great show, and should only be watched if you like lewd and/or imouto themes, want a laugh, or enjoy lots of fanservice and different character tropes.

I'm going to be honest, I disagree with the series at the end, but anyway it was entertaining and as imouto this obviously will have a second season (Only that Eromanga is better than imouto)
Many complain of incest, and the ecchi in the series calling it "Fanservice", I do not think so, that is one of the objectives of the series, to attract attention with ecchi
The protagonist is an idiot that must be admitted, but they expected an anime that has a bit of harem, and some incest
The characters and the animation are well made, it shows fluid and the characters cared from the beginningto the end of the series\n\n
The series is good, do not expect much in the end, it is an anime to spend time nothing more, there is no great story or mystery, only absurd comedy that will make you smile anyway\n
Of course everyone with their tastes, many people believe that the series is bad because they leave it until the 4th episode nothing more, because they believe that there is incest (There is not much, or biologically) or because it has ecchi.\n
If you want to see the anime have an open mind, many people complain only because there is a girl who says something joking.\n
In my opinion is a good as I said, just to pass the time and see the characters well done, a catchy soundtrack.

STORY: Even though there are funny, sexually awkward moments... it's really a fun, cutesy anime to watch. It's really interesting to see the daily lives of Masamune and Sagiri. I'm still wondering why are the parents are not living in the same house as them? Plus, I am still wondering if Sagiri will ever go to school?
CHARACTERS:
Masamune: Amateur author, high school student and brother. He's very caring and protective of Sagiri. He is very passionate for his future of becoming a famous author.
Sagiri: famous illustrator in the manga world -- she's also famous online by her username. But in reality, she's very shy. (She lovesMasamune on the inside).\n\n
OVERALL: The anime was alright. It could always use lots of improvements. (I.e.: Life outside of the house for Sagiri, and more scenes with their parents).

Story: 6
It's basically a brother-sister incest show but the siblings aren't blood related. In this particular instance, they strive to work together to realize a dream to become a professional novel writer/illustrator duo.
Character: 7
They are fun to watch. Each character has their unique idiosyncrasies. Sadly, they're still quite similar to one another in feel, but it's not like you can't tell them apart if you read only their lines with the names blurred. They also do have character development, especially Sagiri who is slowly coming out of her bedroom.
Art: 7
The art is alright, it's not particularly vivid or detailed in design. The backgrounds arepretty modern. There's not much on the backgrounds since a lot of scenes involve Sagiri's bedroom and their family home.\n\n
Sound: 6\n
Ordinary. Nothing too memorable.\n\n
Enjoyment: 7\n
It was alright overall. It's got its funny moments for sure. The tsundere-ish reactions of some of the characters do happen a bit more than I'd like, but that's about it.\n\n
Who's this for:\n
-brother-sister incest lovers\n
-moe lovers. Elf and Sagiri both, even Muramasa to an extent.\n
-slice of life lovers\n
-comedy fans (if you like anime humor)\n
-ecchi fans\n
-harem fans\n\n
Who's this not for:\n
-If you're looking for realistic behavior/reactions, this is far from it\n
-if you want realism in a slice of life work. Really, most professionals doing light novels and illustrations aren't middle schoolers with no parental guardians to watch what they're doing.\n
-action fans\n
-if you want realistic drama\n
-if you were hoping for action, or anything serious

This is a weird one, it isn't perfect, and it may be a bit too incestuous and lewd for some tastes, but I liked it, it has some great heart in it.
Story:   A young light novel writer writes stories, and has a younger adopted sister who is a shut-in, and over the series they get closer and things develop along with friends.
Art:   I like the art, there is some nice traditional art sprinkled throughout it, or least stuff made to look that way.
Characters:    A nice main cast, and supporting chars, mostly other novel writers, I don't really knowenough about the light novel genre in japan outside of what I see in anime, but it was a interesting look into it.   Of course most of it focuses upon the brother and sister.\n\n
Enjoyment and overall:   I enjoyed it, I realize it may not be for everyone, but if your interested in giving it a shot go ahead.

To be completely honest, this is garbage. However, I'm being incredibly lenient on this anime because it does something well. I enjoyed it. Why would someone not enjoy this anime in the first place? It's unethical with incest relationship. How did I enjoy this anime, then? I shut my fucking brain and watched it with my dick. You see, Sagiri is not MY sister and therefore I am allowed to masturbate to her without being bullied. Ok, on a more serious note, what went wrong and what was done well?
Story 2/10:
This is easily the worst aspect of this series. Why? Because this director clearly forgotto create a damned script. I'm pretty sure that one day, he woke up and got a call saying that Eromanga-sensei is going to air on TV tomorrow, and he was like - "What the fuck bro, i'm fucking my sister, call me later.". 


The story doesn't have a purpose. You see, it is actually a story about a horny sister who wants to get hyperfucked by her brother. The brother also wants to insert his machine inside of her. The only saving grace is that she's adopted, which was conveniently done to avoid backlash, which actually failed. Now, another thing which makes this fine is that it's fiction and not real life. This, though, is apparently only agreed with by a few people.


The premise can look incredibly promising with a sister moving in and an aspiring author. There could've been an actual sister & brother relationship that focused on important things that siblings go through, but there's that unnecessary romance tag. The show decided something on the spot and decided to make every girl want the main character's "PP" (727). Because of this, the story centers around every girl trying to do something for Masamune (MC) or them being tsunderes and cursing at him, instead of being productive.


The most annoying part is the main story. Masamune is an aspiring author who wants to make good stories for the world to enjoy. First of all, he got fanletters "first" from two different people, which didn't declare which one of was actually first. Not to mention, they're conveniently a part of the growing harem. This is actually vital, because this indicates that the show is ONLY about Masamune and his harem and NO ONE else. As shown in masterpieces such as Bakuman, writers make groups of friends, haters and heated rivals. None of that is apparent and it really feels empty. In this anime, other people do not even exist. His "rival" turns out to be a tsundere who wanted to bring him down because his recent works are total garbage, which i wholeheartedly agree with. Or i would, but there's absolutely not any preview of the contents of the stories any of them write. Really, for viewers like myself to appreciate what Masamune has done, i should get some insight about his works.


The horny siblings create manga together and guess what they're about? An amazing fighting series with great character development? No, you idiot. As you can see, writing is an entire different language used to communicate with each other. It's clearly got to be about a brother's feelings for his sister. Guess fucking what? GUESS! Masamune uses this shitty story that he made to confess to his sister. Bro, weren't you going to make an amazing series and not confess your love with a professionally licensed light novel?


The anime has two locations. Their home and a beach. Guess what this prevents. World building. The world feels so secluded and only their home area feels a part of the world map. Because Sagiri is a NEET, she doesn't go to a lot of places, her slave of brother doesn't either and we get absolutely no new locations visited.


Finally, the anime brings us a lot of confessions and conflicts, but not a single one of them gets solved. They're brought up and left alone for the days to come. Problems such as having a fucking NEET at home, which doesn't even show signs of letting up by the end of this trash. Which makes me wonder what the fuck the point of Masamune's struggle was. At one point, he admits to stop giving a shit about her staying inside at home and having her face touch fresh air, like a normal human being. What kind of a douchebag of a brother is that?


Long story short, every girl wants his "PP" (727), there is only one other guy who barely gets screentime, and the amazing potential is turned into a harem collection.


Art 7/10:


You know, there's always redeeming qualities of modern works. The art is fairly average, but gets the job done. The colors are incredibly bright and fit the tone of the anime and does reflect the situation they're in. During a romantic scene, the skies are beautifully colored and the usually average animation, turns fluid and captures the scene. The best part would be the  character designs which are fairly unique. Although it is fairly common designed, they're relatively memorable and have their unique design in comparison to other series. When looking at the characters, identifying them will be easy.


Sound 6/10:


The opening song is nice. It does catch the once again, upbeat tone of the series. I've forgotten every single soundtrack inside the show itself, because they left no impact at all. I doubt that anyone remembers anything as well.


The voice acting is really good as most other anime, because of how the emotions are depicted. This section is irrelevant, so let's move on to a more negative part.


Characters 4/10:


Anime has always followed a trend of characters and this is the case here. The most stereotypical characters are here and they are not memorable through their personality at all.


The cast is so small, yet so big that it's bad. There are many characters introduced, but only the harem get screen time. The supporting characters could definitely be given roles where they help the storyline proceed by doing something memorable, but it feels like they're just waste of space who barely have any role at all. They just sit there as extras and watch the main girls fawn upon Masamune and ask him to penetrate them from one end to another.


There's no character development at all. They just stay like bricks and don't change or are given any insight at all. The same applies for relationships, where they get held-up and remain underdeveloped. One character starts off with a NEET problem, which starts off by trying to get fixed. Her tsundere nature also lessens and she turns differently. Guess what happens next? She reverts back to her completely NEET and tsundere state out of nowhere.


The girl characters feel like machines that are attracted to the male lead for no apparent reason. They don't show any individual traits and can only be described through means like "Masamune's tsundere teaser" or "The girl who tried to bring down Masamune but loved him instead". Everything is connected to him and that brings down their personality.


Masamune feels so unserious and stupid. He doesn't seem to be serious with his work. To maintain a life alone with his fuck-buddy, he's been told to earn money. What would be the most efficient way to do that? To write stories that bring in sales; good ones. That's why his stupid confession contradicted his need of money.


Enjoyment 6.5/10:


This show was enjoyable. Because of the slice of life nature with a lot of events (although incoherent), the episodes passed fast, there were some funny moments and it was nice seeing everything that happened. The romantic scenes that were not incest, were well done and left an anticipation dwelling inside of me, later to be crushed. Obviously, some moments were cringe, such as many exchanges between Sagiri and Masamune. A lot of the pointless dialogues were boring.


Overall 4.5/10:


So, what went wrong? This anime lacked correct guidance. The premise had so much potential, but took the wrong direction and ended up becoming a harem anime. There wasn't any development at all and everything was random. Everything was pointless and no conflicts were solved. The characters remained the same and the events were too conveniently based around them. 


To enjoy this, smash the contents of your heads, open your zipper and be ready for some amazing "PP".

Ohh boy, Eromanga-sensei is dangerous skirting LA's topic on incest in anime.
Eromanga-sensei is by the brainchild of Ore no Imouto ga Konnani Kawaii Wake ga Nai's Tsukasa Fushimi and LA is one of those rare people who actually liked Ore no Imouto ga Konnani Kawaii Wake ga Nai as wel as it's second season AND the OVA endings, yet would Eromanga-sensei do even better?...well.......
All things considered especially towards LA's beliefs about incest in anime, it is dangerously on thin ice. For those who don't know LA's beliefs about incest in anime it's that the incest shown in anime either needs to be taken utterly seriouslywhen dealing with incest (such as Ore no Imouto ga Konnani Kawaii Wake ga Nai and Yosuga no Sora) or take it to the comedic nature and "play" around with it (like Oniichan dakedo Ai Sae Areba Kankeinai yo ne!) but to NEVER merge or go in both the extremes of the spectrum LA just stated (like Big Order for the serious motivation as a major plotline and one of the worst cases of incest being abused like this in a comedic degree Oniichan no Koto nanka Zenzen Suki ja Nai n da kara ne!!). So where does Eromanga-sensei lie?...well considering all the factors LA just noted this anime's topic of incest lies in the borderline comedic nature (from it's rampant loli fanservice) of it but takes it's family roots (such as Masamune and Sagiri not being blood siblings and Masamune caring for Sagiri as a guardian and at the same time being utterly dense about Sagiri's romantic feelings for him)...see Eromanga-sensei if anything is dangerously skirting to be on LA's bad side of incest anime but strangely it KNOWS when to keep it away from it's controversial subject matter due to it's comedic nature but at the same time, it's comedic nature gets risque in the name of both Masamune and Sagiri's "work".


Ok, changing subjects.............please. For characters, it does feel like Tsukasa Fushimi easily took inspiration from his previous work Ore no Imouto ga Konnani Kawaii Wake ga Nai. From Sagiri Izumi voiced by Akane Fujita essentially being a less tsundere yet more lewd Kirino, Elf Yamada voiced by Minami Takahashi a more self-aware Kuroneko and Muramasa Senju voiced by Saori Oonishi a more restrained Ayase to finally Masamune Izumi voiced by Yoshitsugu Mastsuoka being a near carbon copy of Kyousuke...denseness and all. LA's favourite character would easily go to Elf Yamada as even though she at first was very annoying, once she opens up to Masamune, she became much easier to deal with and her many schemes to trip up Muramasa was amusing to say the least. Now Sagiri is one of the sources of shameless fanservice in many ways (from how the camera pans at her to just her reactions) and even some of the risque stuff she wants the other harem members to get into is in the level of absurdity (as LA said a more lewd Kirino) and her being a little sister archetype. Yeah....Sagiri easily skirts the lines between sophomoric shameless fanservice and annoying little sister.


Now changing back to the author Tsukasa Fushimi again, but it seems that once again he essentially "writes what he knows" but in the light novel department and although the reality of something like this is slim at times, it is kinda interesting that Tsukasa Fushimi DOES know the reality of light novel creations and the processes to the trials and tribulations it takes (very much so for Ore no Imouto ga Konnani Kawaii Wake ga Nai's anime creation during the first season)...now mix that in to the little sister archetype plot and tons of fanservice can easily put all this down the drain but LA thinks it was saved in both ways (from it's psuedo-incest and the light novel plot altogether) by looking at writing, illustrating and creation of a light novel.


In terms of animation by A1-Pictures, the character designs pops out quite well and with all the characters having exotic looks strikes out in making these characters noticeable. The animation direction is too obviously moe and it runs with it along with it's rampant fanservice, but nonetheless the animation even for this kind of anime is remarkably well done.


As for voice acting, well once again Akane Fujita is in the limelight and well LA as much as Eromanga-sensei as a whole, LA thought she dangerously skirted the line between annoyingly tsun and deredere when she needed to. Akane is tolerable as Sagiri but this role is more or less on thin ice and NOT Akane's worst role for Spring 2017...no there's a role she's done that is ten times as worse as Sagiri. As for the rest of the cast, LA quite enjoyed Minami Takahashi as Elf Yamada and her chunni vocals very much and she nearly got LA's favourite, but the best voice actor for this anime went to Saori Oonishi as Muramasa.


Eromanga-sensei is a rare oddity for LA, from it's rampant loli fanservice and it's constant teasing of incest (to the blatant advances Sagiri has for Masamune and Masamune being the dense main protagonist he is not noticing) but also being a bit serious when dealing with family matters in the form of creating light novels in order for Sagiri and Masamune to continue to be together and although it's not as controversial as Ore no Imouto ga Konnani Kawaii Wake ga Nai, Eromanga-sensei has it's own controversial moments that does feel like it's own thing, but for LA, it couldn't overshadow Ore no Imouto ga Konnani Kawaii Wake ga Nai presences but nonetheless Tsukasa Fushimi has "done it" again in a ways. LA still has major problems with Eromanga-sensei especially when it concerns Sagiri, it's rampant fanservice and the entire incest topic being teased time and again but LA can clearly say from all this that Eromanga-sensei is not a bad incest anime...but it's not great either, enjoy it for it's absurdity the characters go through but roll your eyes away when it goes into obvious incest territories.

***A mostly spoiler free review***
I should not of finished this show. Week after week (save ONE episode which was decent) I sat through this show hoping and praying it would show me something...anything that resembled a decent watch. The show seemingly adds elements in only to waste them later on.
Story: 1/10
This is the first time that I have rated the story element so low. The show's pacing is so horrid that for some arcs they last multiple episodes with almost no progress while others are introduced and completed inside one episode. Also, please tell me there is more to this entire story than male MChopefully getting it in his head that yes his stepsister also wants his genitalia? 


I understand that this is a trash romcom comedy (very light on the actual comedy) but there are so many shows that follow the same formula yet seem to have such amazing story elements.


Art/Animation: 4/10


To start off with; art. This show's artstyle is pretty meh. The characters look cute but their personalities and how they present themselves really ruin it. Also they (the studio) are sexualizing minors. Besides the male MC, all these MCs are under the age of 15. Idc where you are from that is some creepy shit. The show goes out of its way to place the camera in such dirty, awful spots even when it's a character alone on a phone. There is no comedic effect with that, it's just raw fanservice of a 12 year old. The coloring scheme is also really generic. Nothing stands out. This show looks like it was thrown together in an afternoon.


The animation is so barebones. There are maybe 5 or so scenes where there is a framerate buff but other than that it is below the standard of what I would expect from a trashy romcom show. It's sad that when they (the studio) try to make a sexy shot of someone's boobs swaying look like a 2 drawing flip book.


Sound: 3/10


The VAs were decent. They sounded good and somehow got some personality across to their characters (but the lines were stale and not fitting). The music however is some of the worst I have ever heard. The music is trying so fucking hard to invoke an emotional response on the viewer since what is happening on screen is so meaningless. There are great soundtracks/scores that ever so slightly help what is going on screen (and these are the great ones). Then there are ones that put a little more work into directing (not forcing) the audience to feel more emotion. This can be an effective tool (like in Hans Zimmer films) but this show goes too far and has an awful effect on the experience since it is trying to do all the heavy lifting.


Characters: 1/10


Nothing. There was absolutely nothing I liked about the characters. The show doesn't help the characters spread their wings out either. Some characters (like dick girl and the bookstore attendant) just straight up disappear for multiple episodes. Was dick girl's only job to say weird, memy shit and have her panties taken off? I'm sorry but if you introduce an element (like say a character) they have to have a purpose. If that purpose is just to be a fanservice character, fuck you. 


There is very little meaningful character development in this anime. Poor komono girl gets told to fuck off then gets strung around. What's the point of actually finishing her confession arc to just have her stick around later being dragged around and played like a fool? 


Overall: 2.3/10


I do not wish to offend anyone but my god please go watch...ANYTHING ELSE. There are so many more romcoms out there that do a much better job at making you interested in the show. If you want to watch this show due to the cuteness of the characters, just go watch clips of it on YouTube and/or look up gifs/screenshots online. You do not have to watch the show in order to get that enjoyment out of them. This show is one of the reasons that I am genuinely worried about anime. The fact that this show has such high ratings and retention in both the West and the East shows that the average watcher just doesn't care about well crafted works anymore. We will continue to get this half assed garbage and see less more fulfilling shows. Please if you can do not contribute to this trash. There are so many other shows/films that are more worth your time.


Enjoyment 1.6/10


Thanks for reading my review! If you liked my writing style, would like to see some other reviews, or just want to talk, please stop by my page!


Sincerely,

Awesome Drummer

I have to say, it's genuinely terrible, sound direction and all.
Sound is at 2 because the op and ed are nice, and enjoyment is at 8 because I'm a terrible person. The "comedy" is either terrible or a missed opportunity, the characters are forgettable, and you probably would only be here for that one girl who says "I love dick." in episode 2. The best part of the series isn't the actual show, but that it gave us YouTube videos that can actually hit the marks for comedy, unlike the show did. Just imagine Oreimo, but even more lazily slapped together by A1 Pictures.

(Usually I don't write reviews for ongoing animes. This will be an exception since imao its development would not change much my opinion towards it. I will make modifications to this review as the show progresses. )
General: It is in my assumption that almost anyone who picks up this anime has probably watched Oreimo already. Indeed they come from the same author and both have 'incest' tags, but I think this two shows are not quite as similar as people would expect. This show, especially its character interaction, is more similar to animes like Saekano (Saenai Heroine no Sodatekata) than to Oreimo, at least inmy opinion. 

In recent years, I have the impression that there is a boom of animes describing otaku lives and jobs. Just to name a few we have Oreimo, Umaru, Saekano, Shirobako, Sore ga Seiyuu, New Game!, Girlish Number, etc. So far Eromanga Sensei fails to distinguish itself from the multitude, relying on largely generic characters and plots. 


Story: skipped since there really isn't too much to talk about. 


Character: Most of the characters here feel very cliche, with a few exceptions. So far the MC has pretty much behaved the same way as Kyousuke in Oreimo first season. On the other hand, the heroine Sagiri (MC's sister) is fairly different from Kirino in Oreimo. I would say she is much less 'belligerent' and much gentler towards his brother, even though she could occasionally be unappreciative to her brother's care about her daily lives. In any case she appears to 'deserving' her brother's love and care much more than Kirino or say Umaru, for that matter. It is noticeable that so far there is no equivalent of Kuroneko or Ayase (though the girl with long black hair in the manga store could be an otaku-ish version of Manami) who has the potential to 'steal' her brother. Looks like the author (Fushimi Tsukasa) is determined to write a true brother-sister light romance this time. 

Among the other supporting characters I want to mention the small girl with orange hair, who seems to absorb all the 'bitchiness' to herself. She once said directly to MC that she loves dicks, for example. Dislikable as she is, I have to admit that she is in some sense unique, although not necessarily in a good way. 

I won't mention other characters because they have not shown any interesting parts enough to be talked about. 


Sound: ClariS (Oreimo, Madoka, Nisekoi) performed the opening, and TrySail (High School Fleet) performed the ending. Being established singer groups (especially ClariS) their songs are stable, if not particular catchy. 

For voice acting, Matsuoka as a veteran voice actor, especially of otaku characters (Sora@NGNL, Aki Tomoya@Saekano) and elder brothers (Sora, Kirito@SAO), is of course adept in performing here. The heroine is done by a relatively less known voice actress, who nevertheless handled very well a variety of different voices. Other voice acting seems also decent to me. 


Score: 5.5-6/10 Fairly made for a mediocre show

like i've said on my profile page, I usually only rate an anime that is at least a 9/10, for me, but i felt obligated to write one since it is one of my first completed seasonal anime. 
Thus, let me sum up this anime with two words: "Overrated" and "Over-hyped". To be honest I came into this with low expectations since i usually don't watch these types of anime, but even then i was quite disappointed. 
Oh, and I didn't factor the art or the sound into the overall score. because i usually have very very low standards for those, and its a newanime so it should have good art and sound. 


Story:

its just a story that isn't great, but it isn't that bad either. the basic premise is that a relationship is supposed to start between two step-siblings who are also connected through their collaboration on lewd manga. Yes this is a major oversimplification of the plot, but even then it failed at that. Progression wise, there was none. Romance wise there was little. a big part of it was comedy, but even then the comedy wasn't funny. but like I pointed out before, progression wise there is none. and thats where it really fails for me. I don't particularly enjoy incest, but i did go into this with an open mind to the romance of it, but even then I was disappointed. The entire series might as well be an intro and filler episodes. Nothing of importance happens, nothing of any real substance happens either. no progression of any sort of romance. No progression of any semblance of a relationship beyond platonic friends. no progression of any story. So a plot-less story that doesn't really do anything wrong, but also excels at nothing. It's pretty much below average, a painfully realistic incest story. which is another reason why it sucks because in the realm of anime it should be able to explore themes that are generally forbidden or taboo in society (such as incest), but in this one it doesn't even do that properly. Anime pushes the boundaries of what is acceptable in society, but this anime with it's obvious incest undertones did not even dip a toe into those waters. So overall, its not funny, its not dramatic, nor is it romantic. quite sad. As for good parts, uhm... there is a good goal i guess of being a manga writer but even then, goal not entirely realized. 


Art

Well art is crisp and animation is fluid. its what you would expect from an anime that is new and just finished airing. Character designs were probably the only redeeming part of it, as the character designs I could actually appreciate. However it does fall into the MCHWCH trap (Main Character Has Weird Colored Hair) as almost all of the girls have hair colors that are not considered "realistic" but thats just a preferential thing for me. 


Sound

I gave it a 7, but mostly for the animation within the songs, in particular the Closing song. a cute, short, and lively dance from Sagiri was the only thing I looked forward to in this anime, and thats saying quite a bit, as I hate almost every opening/closing song (to me its a waste of time). But they did take that out in the last few episodes so... Uhm anyways the voice actors were great, they matched the character's personalities well, but that is also kinda expected for an anime of this day and age.


Character

Basically trash. little to no character progression. They basically go through the same motions for 12 episodes, or whenever they decide to appear. And on top of that the characters are all the same. Each girl that enters first dislikes the MC, but later on wants to get it on with him. the MC on the other hand, is just the same as any generic dense harem MC who either doesn't know or doesn't give  any craps about it. Not only that, but none of the girls become clear frontrunners, they all are too shy to admit that they like the MC, basically a bunch of tsuns around a dense MC who doesn't see the harem forming around him because the characters are tsuns. so a boring story for something labeled a romance. 


Enjoyment

you can probably already tell. I didn't enjoy this much. 3 points basically adds up as "character design" + "decent VAs" + "Sagiri dance" = 3. which is literally that. \n

Overall:

its 1 episode of set up and 11 episodes of filler. its Over-hyped and overrated. It has nice character designs and thats about it. If theres one thing about it that's good, its that it is consistent. Consistently bad that is. Its predictable, and doesn't tackle any sort of real problems, and on top of that there isn't any good ecchi to reedeem itself. So yea I guess this is going to be the shortest math equation to my overall score that I've ever given so here goes: 1 for character design + 1 for sound = 2 overall. 


It just does nothing right other than that.

I believe the words of Kazuhira Miller from Metal Gear Solid V: The Phantom Pain best explain the feelings I had when I was watching this show.
"Why are we still here? Just to suffer?"
What can I say. It is not really possible to spoil Eromanga-sensei, because there really is nothing in the story that a regular fan of anime has not already seen a thousand times over. This show is one of those things you creep out people who haven't seen anything like it- lolicon, siscon, domination. Unlike Domestic na Kanojo (which I would contend was making its point about legitimising sexual relationships between step-siblingsand between a student and a teacher to an extent where it gets almost political, since most of the major characters don't have a problem with it), the parents in Eromanga-sensei are absent, making it no different from the pseudo-incest hentai that portray such relationships. Of course, while the hentai features the siblings having sex with each other, the absence here is used to portray characters who recreate yet another harem around the pathetic male-character who just can't seem to say or do anything wrong in front of the ever-increasing coterie of girls who like him.


I have never felt true despair like I did while watching this show. Pigeon Blood was at least offensive. This is just stuffed to the throat with time-tested tropes that will never offend enough to anyone who has seen enough anime.


I have seen enough anime. 


Oh no.

TL;DR Section at the end of the review. This review may or may not contain minor spoilers.
Eromanga-sensei is trash... and so am I.
In the great words of gigguk, this show is a "modern masterpiece... of trash." The entire idealization of OreImo is a story on it's own, but Eromanga has found yet another way to make "incest in wincest" really cruel to watch. With the age cap being at 12, the whole basis of the show is to weed out the people who need to go to jail for the rest of their life. 
The plot of the story is that young Masamune Izumi hasbeen trying to get his younger sister (who's not related by blood) out of her room because he hasn't seen her since the day they met. As the story progresses you learn that he really wants to be a good big brother, and she really loves him and wishes he would love her back (because they aren't blood related). You can see where this is going at this point. Beyond that, you have three other twelve year-old girls who all like Masamune as well (some of them even confess!). This is the premise for a new "dark imouto wars of 2013" but it surprisingly doesn't really pass this point, as they sell out the fact that Sagiri (the younger sister) is supposed to be the best *because* she likes and draws ecchi. Woo. I don't think I've ever felt more disgraceful as a human being up until watching this show.\n\n
While there's more to say about the art, animation, soundtrack, in the end, none of that really matters. It all comes down to the story, and whether or not you enjoyed it. If not, congrats! You belong in the group that didn't like it. You can proudly throw out your chest and say "This show is trash!"\n\n
But if you liked it? You can shamelessly throw out your chest and exclaim "This show is trash... and so am I!"

So I jumped in to this anime with neutral opinions and hoping for a show with at least a sub par plot with decent char development.
Yeah... Turns out you get that with 3 minute out of a 20+ per episode. Then followed up by more "Nii-san no baaakaa!"
The plot is intriguing at start, and char was a mystery and something to make me wonder and want to know more about them. But by ep3 thing's get stale as the plot is as common as sand is in the Caribbean. And the characters just gradually gets stale along with their development for me to personally careor want to know. I can't say more about it as I do not want to proceed with the next episode wasting my weekend of trying to finish this series. \n\n
Though we do get good songs out of it by Claris. And praises to A1 pictures with their beautiful artstyle is a given so kudos for the sound and art.\n\n
Truth be told, I was warned about this anime. I was warned.
